definition: small arched door/boudoir/lady's chamber/by ext. women
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: I rode in the women's car, as usual.
sentences.chinese: 跟以往一样，我坐在了“闺房车厢”。

sentences.english: She made three paces thro' the room.
sentences.chinese: 她于闺房跨出三个脚步。

sentences.english: To greet the bride from her bedroom.
In my boudoir I sigh over the close of spring.
sentences.chinese: 我在闺房中叹息着春天的结束。

sentences.english: Her boudoir is clean and tidy.
But who will be the master of my boudoir then?
sentences.chinese: 但谁将是这个闺房的新主人呢？

sentences.english: Males may use their feathers to attract harems of several hens.
sentences.chinese: 雄性孔雀会用他们的羽毛吸引闺房的雌鸟。

sentences.english: Her boudoir is clean and tidy.
Beauty boudoir glass harp, the prodigal son look forward to hearing from you soon.
sentences.chinese: 佳人闺房琉璃琴，窗外浪子候佳音。

sentences.english: Twenty-eight years of womanly life and all so lonesome.
sentences.chinese: 二十八年的闺房生活却如此寂寥。

sentences.english: I have several intimates with whom to share my secrets.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个闺房密友可以分享我的秘密。

sentences.english: It's easy, and it's something you can do in the privacy of your own room at home.
sentences.chinese: 很简单，在你的闺房中就可以轻松完成。

sentences.english: With thunders and lightnings he entered the chamber of Semele.
sentences.chinese: 他一阵闪电雷鸣冲进了塞墨勒的闺房。

definition: central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
bed and bamboo sleeping mat/(fig.) bed as a place for intimacy
